reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed here 1 night while visiting Kartchner Caverns. I chose this hotel because of previous reviews. I realize that I tend to be a picky person when it comes to hotels, but I would still rate this hotel as "just OK". The outside looks decent enough, aside from all the weeds everywhere. When we were checking in the desk clerk somehow felt that he needed to let us know that he was called in on his day off and wasn't happy about it. The lobby, hallways, and rooms are average. The things that turned me off were the pillow cases with holes in them, the bottom sheet that barely held on, and worst of all the blanket was actually a foam rubber blanket (dark harvest gold color). I did not even want to touch it. Maybe it used to be a Veluxe blanket and lost all its fuzz or something, I'ver never seen anything like it before. The towels in the bathroom were very thin, and the cleanliness was just so-so. We didn't bother with breakfast and just ate at the Denny's next door. All in all there is not a big selection of hotels in Benson, but I'm glad we only had to stay the one night.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: This is an above-average Days Inn property. The rooms are nicely furnished and very clean. The hotel interior is also more tasteful than many other locations. I agree with the previous review about the poor breakfast, but luckily there is a Denny's adjacent, so I satisfied my stomach there. All in all this is a nice place to stay when you are on your way through the desert of southern Arizona.
reviews.title: Very nice for Days Inn

reviews.text: I reserved at the Day's Inn in Benson only because the drive to a city with more choices would have made for an uncomfotably long day. Based on past experiences with this chain's properties, I wasn't expecting much more than a conveniently located, marginally clean, bare-bones budget motel. Wrong!
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: We called in advance and were given a set rate. When we got there, I mentioned we had AAA and AARP, but no further discount was given (although the AAA book indicates one should have been). The desk clerk said they give the discount automatically in the price they quote, since almost all their customers are AAA or AARP, or military. The lobby was very nice, but when we got to our room, it was dirty. There were dead bugs on the bathroom floor and it looked as if the mirror and surfaces had not been washed in quite some time. The carpet obviously had not been vacuumed. There were water bottles, etc., in there from the prior occupants. When I mentioned this to the desk clerk, I was told their housekeeping staff had quit and so he didn't know the condition of the rooms. I'm sympathetic, but the answer I expected in this situation was that they were sorry and would either have someone come clean it immediately or to have been placed in a clean room.
reviews.title: I can't recommend them
Lies, Lies, and more Lies...
reviews.text: My daughter is diabetic and had not eaten in some time, and we had driven a very long way, so I decided we'd get something to eat and then approach this problem again when the front desk was less busy. It was about 5pm and they had several people up there needing to check in or deal with issues. (If I hadn't been so tired, I guess I would have gotten a clue from that, wouldn't I?)

The hotel is in the middle of renovation, putting new carpet in, etc. - we were not told our room was in the middle of renovation - no baseboards, beds that were leaning at an awful angle, etc. We asked if there were other rooms available and were told no by the front desk person. There were not a terribly large number of cars in the parking lot, so I assume it was that the rooms were not functional or cleaned rather than the place being completely full.
reviews.title: Won't Advise Staying There

reviews.text: When we were unable to connect to the wireless Internet a bit later and again asked for another room, the manager cleaned one (all their housekeeping staff had quit to go to work for Walmart (?)) himself. That room was fine - the beds were much better, no dead bugs or trash. The router on that side of the building worked (the other was broken). If we'd have been checked into this room initially we'd never have known there was anything wrong about this hotel.
reviews.title: OK for the price

reviews.text: Not once, during this entire stay, did anyone offer us either an apology or a discount for our inconvenience. The staff are overworked and understandably cranky, but when I pay for a good room I expect one. Once they get their personnel problems worked out, and the renovations complete, it looks as if it will be a lovely little hotel. But, until they do so, it's kind of a rip-off waiting to happen.
reviews.title: Ricky the Roach lives here

likes.liked: — It was close to Tombstone AZ

reviews.text: Bathroom was not cleaned, had to ask front desk for cleaning product to clean tub.
reviews.title: Look at your room first!!!! Dirty.

likes.liked: — Very close to freeway.....for quick getaway!!!

reviews.title: Needs refurbishing and a good cleaning
reviews.text: Management did nothing about the problem.

Typical of most of the Days Inns that I've stayed at. Room was basic but clean, shower looked to be a recently done "bath fitter" special. We were just looking for a place to pull off the Interstate for the night and this hotel fit the bill - nothing fancy and a fair price (about $65 US with an AAA discount). Sheets were a little thin and the bed seemed well worn but still comfortable.
reviews.title: Basic room, fair price

reviews.text: Close to a number of restaurants within short driving distance on the other side of the freeway. Front desk clerk was able to give good directions and recommended some non-chain restaurants. Free internet access in the lobby.
reviews.title: Good Traveler Motel

reviews.text: Continental breakfast starts at 6:00am - bagels and cream cheese, cereal, fruit, toast, coffee and tea.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — free breakfast could have included a few more items

reviews.text: Of note to birders - there is a "pond" by the nearby golf course that was fairly productive for ducks, swallows, and other birds. Worth checking out. Directions are available at the front desk.
reviews.title: Not worth the money spent

reviews.text: Was traveling through the area and needed a place to stop for the night. Not being entirely sure what motel was where, or how far I was willing to continue driving, I used my smartphone to browse for motels in the Benson, Arizona area. I found the Days Inn, at $49.99/night, which seemed to be a very reasonable price for one of these motels. I attempted to book through the Wyndham Rewards website, then proceeded the rest of the distance to the motel.
reviews.title: The worst place to stay...
